content: Calculate the volume of a cylinder with a radius of 5 cm and a height of 10 cm.

To calculate the volume of a cylinder, you can use the formula:

\[ V = \pi r^2 h \]

where:

- \( V \) is the volume,

- \( r \) is the radius of the base,

- \( h \) is the height of the cylinder,

- \( \pi \) (pi) is approximately 3.14159.

Given that the radius \( r \) is 5 cm and the height \( h \) is 10 cm, you can plug these values into the formula:

\[ V = \pi \times (5 \, \text{cm})^2 \times 10 \, \text{cm} \]

First, calculate the square of the radius:

\[ (5 \, \text{cm})^2 = 25 \, \text{cm}^2 \]

Then, multiply by \( \pi \):

\[ 25 \, \text{cm}^2 \times \pi \approx 25 \times 3.14159 \approx 78.53975 \, \text{cm}^3 \]

Finally, multiply by the height:

\[ 78.53975 \, \text{cm}^3 \times 10 \, \text{cm} = 785.3975 \, \text{cm}^3 \]

So, the volume of the cylinder is approximately 785.4 cubic centimeters.

**Note:** The exact value depends on the precision of \( \pi \) used in the calculation. If more accuracy is needed, you can use a more precise value of \( \pi \).
